main event: A white, football-shaped object was observed in the sky near Saugerties, New York on January 16, 1966.
interesting points: The object was approximately the size of a dime at arm's length.
A smaller object was seen moving away from the larger object towards the west.
The object was observed for 1 hour and 30 minutes, moving back and forth between the northwest and west.
There was a strong temperature inversion in the atmosphere at the time of the sighting.
The New York State Police confirmed the sighting by two patrolmen.
witnesses: civilian observer, New York State Police patrolmen
photographs: possibly, but none were developed and submitted with the report
